critique: This executive order implements UN Security Council Resolution 253, placing sanctions on Southern Rhodesia. This action is motivated by international cooperation and human rights concerns related to the situation in Southern Rhodesia at the time. It restricts trade and financial interactions with the region, with exceptions for humanitarian purposes. The order delegates enforcement responsibilities to various departments and emphasizes consultation with the Secretary of State. It does not inherently expand executive power but rather acts within existing legal frameworks and international obligations.
